page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT TEDSTONE DELAMERE
page.content: In such a sparsely populated rural area agriculture is the main source of employment. Family-owned or tenanted farms, worked by the owner/tenant with help from family, predominate. Amalgamation of land into bigger farms results in the freeing of some houses for sale. These are usually bought by urban workers from outside the area who commute daily to large conurbations. Their wives work part-time locally as doctors receptionists, nursing aids in homes for elderly persons, as homehelps or in various capacities in schools. There is a small horse-training stable. A farmers wife runs an art gallery. She attends rural shows both locally and nationally, selling prints and original paintings.
